We live here. We play here.
We know northern gear.

settings.title: Can’t find what you need? Email support@tsgyukon.com
Trail Notes & Community Notes
settings.subheading: We have so much to share about the Outdoors and our wonderful Territory!

settings.question: Can I just talk to a real person please?
settings.answer: Yes!  Call us between 11-6, Monday to Saturday 867-667-4074, you’ll get a brief electronic voice (sorry) and then a real person. Or you can email support@tsgyukon.com

settings.question: How does shipping work?
settings.answer: We will ship across Canada for free (except Quèbec) on orders over $50. Sorry we can’t mail hazardous goods and oversized items (ex; skis, fuel, bear spray, running chariots). You can pick up these items in store.  Or email support@tsgyukon.com to make special shipping arrangements.

settings.question: How long until I get my new items?
settings.answer: We will ship within 2 business days. Canada Post reports shipping in Yukon within 6 business days. Outside of Yukon is from 6 (Edmonton) to 13 (St John’s) business days. Covid-19 is of course causing shipping difficulties.

settings.question: Where is my order and how do I track it?
settings.answer: As soon as your order is out for shipping we’ll send you an email with the Canada Post tracking number so that you can follow its progress!

settings.question: Can I return my purchase?
settings.answer: You can return unused, unopened, clean items with their original labels and tags- in other words, items in perfect condition- within 90 days of purchase. For safety and hygiene reasons the following items cannot be returned or exchanged: swimsuits, underwear and bras (base layers like long johns are not underwear), bear safety items, fuel, all climbing gear, helmets, GPS and other locator products, all food items, sunscreen & lip balm, all fluids, waxes and sprays.

settings.question: Can’t I buy or use a gift card online?
settings.answer: This is our first version of a website and we couldn't make our gift card system talk to our till!  We are working hard to solve this problem! Sorry to disappoint! Please come to the store to buy one or to use one as payment!

settings.question: I live in the States. Can I buy items from your online store?
settings.answer: So sorry but our brands will not allow us to ship outside of Canada. You can however, place orders then come for in-store pick up. We recommend this for visitors like our Arctic Ultra racers who must be sure to have certain gear. Please notify support@tsgyukon.com if you will not arrive at the store within 1 week of placing your order.

settings.question: Why can’t I order to an address in Québec?
settings.answer: So sorry but our vendor agreements prevent us. Please come visit us in person!

settings.question: What if my item is damaged when I receive it?
settings.answer:
Please take a photo of the tracking number and the damage to the packaging (if possible) -and of the item- and email it to support@tsgyukon.com

We will contact you to figure out the best solution: we want you to be delighted with your purchase, not disappointed.

settings.question: What payment methods does Coast Mountain accept?
settings.answer: We can accept Visa & Mastercard credit cards and Visa Debit cards online. In our store we can accept Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Debit cards and, believe it or not, cash.

settings.question: I need assistance with planning gear for my team or my expedition.
settings.answer: Email us and one of our staff who specializes in the activities or group that you describe will get back to you. Yes we can have custom apparel and items made. Yes we know about packing for bush planes, canoes and pulks. Yes we have helped miners, endurance racers and mushroom pickers. We are happy to help with questions about our beloved Yukon too! Just email support@tsgyukon.com

settings.question: Why was my order cancelled?
settings.answer: Our system will cancel an order when billing information doesn’t match our verification process. We apologize in advance for any inconvenience if this happens. Please email support@tsgyukon.com

settings.question: What if I find an item for less?
settings.answer: We will price match any Canadian retailer. If you find the item listed for less at the time of purchase we will be happy to match it. Please email the information about the other store or send the link to support@tsgyukon.com If it’s the exact same item we will match the price. And, in advance, we want to thank you for persevering with us and for buying local!!

settings.question: I still have a question or a problem!
settings.answer: Don’t hesitate to call us Monday to Saturday, 11-6 at 867-667-4074 or email us anytime at support@tsgyukon.com We will get back to emails during working hours.

settings.title: Can’t find what you need? Email support@tsgyukon.com

settings.text:
At Arc’teryx, the goal is to create products that are as good as they can possibly be, performing over time and beyond expectation.  This is the heart of what they do and the roots of their company —to create what does not yet exist.

They develop simple solutions to complex challenges; this is the essence of their minimalism and their philosophy of design.

Coast has carried Arc’teryx for almost 30 years.

icebreaker looks to nature for the answers and for innovative ways to do more with less. Working with what nature provides and adapting as nature does, icebreaker enables consumers to join a movement towards choosing natural and preserving our planet for generations to come.

We love icebreaker merino wool.  It is warm when wet, it is sustainable and recyclable, it regulates body temperature, it does not itch and it is oh, so beautiful.

Mountain Hardwear was founded in 1993 by a small band of outdoor industry iconoclasts… They strive to do things differently: from the first taped soft shell jacket to the first tent with 180 degree views, their products combine cutting edge with unconventional.

We at Coast have loved Mountain Hardwear designs for many years… so many of them industry award winning… Think of Stretchdown, the Ghost Whisperer, the amazing Dynama pants and oh so much more!

Founded in a small warehouse in Toronto in 1957, Canada Goose has grown into one of the world's leading makers of performance luxury apparel.  Every collection is informed by the rugged demands of the Arctic and inspired by relentless innovation and uncompromised craftmanship. 

In the Yukon, Canada Goose provides the luxury of warmth in -40c in addition to beautiful layering pieces and accessories.

Patagonia's mission statement:

We are in business to save our home planet. 

The buyers at Coast curate our Patagonia selection to ensure we have the best items for Yukoners: for our climate and our lives. 

Patagonia, assisted by Coast Mountain Sports, has funded an ongoing study of the Ibex watershed and the salmon who call it home. Kwanlin Dunn First Nation, Fisheries & Oceans Canada, Yukon River Panel and the Yukon Fish & Game Association are measuring water temperatures and their effect on salmon return.  Detailed information available in our blog.

Rab's story began in 1981 in the attic of a small, terraced house in Sheffield, England where Rab Carrington made the first sleeping bag to bear his name. 

From the moment that our buyers saw Rab, they knew it was perfect for Yukon.  Great insulated pieces in wonderful colours.  Technical sleeping bags.  Great outdoor heritage.

The North Face fundamental mission remains unchanged since 1966: provide the best gear for our athletes and the modern day explorer, support the preservation of the outdoors, and inspire a global movement of exploration.

We've been partners with The North Face for over 35 years to explore our Yukon and our World.

Pull-on, kick off easy. Try Blundstones and you’ll be a fan for life.

In Yukon we wear ‘em to the mountains & trails, to work and to weddings. There’s a Blundstone Winter boot with Thinsulate and sheepskin for ‘round town snow use… or just wear your summer Blunnies with a good pair of wool socks in winter. Not -30 material but hey you’ll scratch through in town.


These Boots are Unisex and have Australian sizing.


For women subtract 3 sizes from your Canadian size.
For men subtract 1 size from your Canadian size.
For kid’s subtract 1 size from your Canadian size.

Help Someone in Need & Save $50 on a New Winter Jacket.

Bring a used winter jacket for adults or children in to Coast Mountain Sports by Wednesday October 21st and you will receive a coupon for $50 off the purchase of a brand new winter coast worth $250 or more!  The jackets will be cleaned by the High Country Inn and distributed by the Yukon Anti-Poverty Coalition to people who need them. 

Here's the Details: Jackets that you bring in can be for adults or for children and must be insulated and in good condition. You will receive one $50 off coupon for every coat that you bring in.  It is valid towards the purchase of any in-stock, regular priced jacket worth $250 or more from Coast Mountain Sports or Sports Experts on Main Street, Whitehorse until October 31st 2020. Only one Share the Warmth coupon can be used for every new jacket purcahsed.  The coupons are not valid for special orders and the discount can not be combined with any other discount or offer.  This coupon excludes Canada Goose jackets.  Can't bring your old jackets in?  Email support@tsgyukon.com and we will work with you to help others... and to get $50 off! huge thanks to Air North

Yukoner Appreciation has been around for a long time. It’s always been our way of celebrating our amazing territory and thanking Yukoners for their support. This year, more than ever, we are excited to recognize Yukoners and say Thank you. Thank you for believing in us and thank you for making an effort to support local.

We have offered specials throughout the store. X-ski and all snow related equipment, electronics and certain brands must be excluded due to inventory issues and dealer agreements.

settings.title: Merino
settings.subheading: Your cold weather friend.

settings.text:
Online Only E-Gift Cards

Give the best outdoor equipment, footwear, and clothing, carefully chosen for northern life! Choose from our $25, $50, $100, $250 or $500 e-gift cards! Or Available in $25 increments up to $500

In-Store Only Gift Cards

Would you rather give the gift of in-store shopping?  In-store only cards are valid at our Coast Mountain Sports store, at Sports Experts, and at Hougen’s SportsLodge here on Main Street in Whitehorse, Yukon.

settings.header_text: Choose from E-Gift Cards or In-Store Gift Cards
settings.bottom_text:
We’ve set up $25, $50, $100, $250, or $500 gift cards that we will send out for you.

Or Available in $25 increments up to $500

Please note, due to technical reasons, on-line cards cannot be used in the stores

and in-store cards cannot be used online at this time. 

We cannot ship to Québec or outside of Canada.

No gift cards can be redeemed or exchanged for cash. 

Gift cards cannot be replaced if they are stolen, lost or, damaged.
